synopsis.text:
Kazuki Sendou's journey into the world of doujinshi, or self-published manga, begins when he fails his art college entrance exam. Encouraged by his childhood friend, Taishi Kuhonbutsu, Kazuki dives headfirst into the vibrant and diverse community of doujin creators, finding inspiration and camaraderie among its members.

Despite his unique artistic style, Kazuki struggles to make significant sales at comic conventions. However, the joy of creating and sharing his work with a small but dedicated group of fans, most of whom are female, keeps him motivated. Along the way, he encounters a colorful cast of characters who represent various aspects of the doujin community, from singing idols to printing business owners, and even a cosplay fight.

Kazuki's circle of friends is a source of both support and chaos, with personalities ranging from the arrogant Eimi to the artistically experienced Yuu. As he navigates the ups and downs of the doujin world, Kazuki strives to improve his craft and secure a coveted spot in the convention's Kabe Circle.

This anime offers a unique glimpse into the world of doujinshi, showcasing the passion, creativity, and camaraderie that define this vibrant community. With its engaging characters and tragicomic events, it's a must-watch for anyone interested in the behind-the-scenes world of manga creation.
synopsis.author: mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0
